ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes I would highly recommend it, it is extremely useful for gaining knowledge of patristic Greek as well as other matters involving apocryphal Christian texts, important theologians, and other Christian writings.

I would recommend RLST 665 to a student who is comfortable reading Greek and is looking for an introduction to the breadth of genres of patristic literature and to some of the ways in which this literature intersects with the New Testament and with the religious and philosophical worlds of the ancient Mediterranean.
You read a lot of patristic greek.
Translating a wide range of interesting early Christian literature in Greek. For those interested in the topic, yes! Take the class.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Yes it greatly deepened my knowledge and did contribute to my research!
It helped introduce me to literature that I had not read before, which was very helpful.
It gave good language training and also some more cultural/historical content.
